alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 8:18PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Johnson and Wilkinson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Between 14 and 17 feet, Bankfull conditions are reached along the river. The Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and right bank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge...will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 16.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 18.9 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.4 feet on 12/17/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
